text: Pyrausta flavofascialis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Augustus Radcliffe Grote in 1882. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from western Texas to Arizona. It is also found in Mexico. The wingspan is about 21 mm. The forewings are olivaceous at the base, shading to yellowish. The median area and terminal space is purple. The hindwings are pale with a fuscous terminal line. Bulletin of the United States Geological and Geographical Survey of the Territories 6 (3): 577 Adults are on wing in May and from July to September. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1882 flavofascialis Category:Moths of North America
title: Pyrausta flavofascialis
